sections.title: Assets Assessment
sections.help_text: This helps me understand what savings, property, or other funds might help pay for care. Enter what you're comfortable sharing ‚Äî I'll handle the math.

info_boxes.message: üí° Inputs stay visible. Open a Quick Guide anytime for examples or definitions.

sections.title: Household Context
sections.help_text: Let me know if anyone else shares ownership or limits how assets can be used.

fields.label: Do you share assets with a spouse or partner?

options.label: No, assets are only in my name
Yes, but we keep finances separate
Yes, we pool assets for care decisions

fields.help: Helps me understand which resources are truly available for care.

fields.label: Any legal or family restrictions on using these assets?
fields.help: Example: community property rules, assets earmarked for a spouse, or power-of-attorney considerations.

info_boxes.message: üë• If assets are co-owned, note who must approve decisions. This prevents surprises when planning how to pay for care.

fields.label: Checking & Savings
fields.help: Total balance in all checking and savings accounts

fields.label: Investment Accounts
fields.help: 401(k), IRA, brokerage, stocks, bonds, mutual funds

fields.label: Any loans or pledges against these accounts?
fields.help: Margin loans, pledged accounts, or other debts secured by these funds

fields.label: Outstanding loan balance tied to these accounts
fields.help: Enter the total balance owed that is secured by these liquid assets

info_boxes.message: üí∞ Liquid assets are important for immediate care costs. Average for seniors: $100,000‚Äì$250,000 (varies widely). Medicaid allows up to $2,000 for individuals (2024).

sections.title: Property & Real Estate
sections.help_text: Your home and other real estate holdings

fields.label: Primary Residence Value
fields.help: Estimated market value of your current home

fields.label: Mortgage, HELOC, or other debt on this home?
fields.help: Check if you owe money against the primary residence

fields.label: Outstanding balance on the primary residence
fields.help: Remaining mortgage, HELOC, or reverse mortgage balance

fields.label: Interested in home sale or equity options?
fields.help: Check to explore selling, reverse mortgages, or HELOCs

fields.label: How quickly could you access funds from the home?

options.label: Would take more than a year
Not planning to use home equity

fields.help: Gives a sense of liquidity for care planning timelines.

fields.label: Other Real Estate
fields.help: Rental properties, vacation homes, land, etc.

fields.label: Debt on other real estate?
fields.help: Include mortgages or loans tied to rental/vacation properties

fields.label: Outstanding balance on other real estate
fields.help: Remaining mortgage or loan balances on other properties

info_boxes.message: üè† Median U.S. home value ~$420,000 (2024). Primary home is often Medicaid-exempt (up to equity limits), but outstanding loans reduce usable equity. Note timing or tenant issues that could slow access to funds.

fields.label: Vehicles / Valuables / Other Assets
fields.help: Vehicles, jewelry, collectibles, business interests, etc.

info_boxes.message: üíé Include: Vehicles (current market value), jewelry/collectibles (appraised value), business ownership stakes. Consider which assets could realistically be sold for care costs.

sections.title: Outstanding Debts & Obligations
sections.help_text: Debts reduce what you can put toward care. Capture anything tied to these assets.

fields.label: Loans secured by investments or insurance
fields.help: Outstanding loans backed by brokerage accounts, annuities, or life insurance policies

fields.label: Other debts impacting care budget
fields.help: Credit lines, personal loans, or medical bills that must be paid before using assets for care

fields.label: Details about these debts
fields.help: Include payoff timelines, co-signers, or anything that could complicate using assets for care.

info_boxes.message: üìâ Knowing debts helps estimate net assets. Add payoff schedules so we can time care funding correctly.

sections.title: Access & Liquidity Notes
sections.help_text: Share anything that affects how quickly these assets can support care.

fields.label: Do you see any issues accessing these funds quickly?

options.label: No, funds are easy to access
Need to wait for market timing
Family members rely on these assets

fields.help: Helps flag areas where we may need backup funding sources.

fields.label: Liquidity or access details
fields.help: Mention surrender periods, beneficiaries who must approve changes, or plans to keep certain assets untouched.
